The President must explain his policy towards Iran and give the American people confidence that we have a coherent strategy for protecting our embassies, our troops, and our national security.
In July, I was proud to stand with colleagues, on both sides of the aisle, to prohibit the Administration from entering into a conflict with Iran without proper congressional authorization.

My time serving as a paratrooper in Iraq taught me that using force without a strategy & clearly defined goals rarely ends well. While we are still learning details, one thing is clear: only Congress can declare war and the President has not sought any such authorization.

The question is not whether Qasem Soleimani was a threat to the United States, the question is whether President Trump has a strategy in place to deal with the potentially seismic events that he has unleashed.

Looking forward to hosting our first Crow on Your Corner of the new year! I'll be at Endless Grind in Aurora on Saturday at 9 am. Come by, say hi, and let me know what's your mind as we head into 2020. https://t.co/GzbWz6C7Ol
